alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 7:44PM PDT until August 21 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Ventura County in southwestern California... * Until 300 AM PDT Monday. * At 744 PM PDT, a DANGEROUS AND LIFE THREATENING FLASH FLOODING SITUATION is developing from Point Mugu and Camarillo eastward through Thousand Oaks and Woodland Hills area. Local law enforcement reported flash flooding across the warned area, vehicles have been stranded. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain from Tropical Storm Hilary is producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges, reported by law enforcement. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, western Malibu, Ojai, Chatsworth, Moorpark, Santa Paula, Port Hueneme, Rose Valley, Newbury Park, Ventura Harbor, Point Mugu State Park, Point Mugu, Lockwood Valley, Oak Park and Topatopa Peak. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: STAY OFF THE ROADS. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
